queue.tweet: US markets edge toward records as rate-cut bets firm up on cooler inflation and robust tech. S&P 500 and Nasdaq hold highs, Dow lags on earnings rotations. Week ahead: Fed decision on Sep 17, CPI/PPI data, and mega-cap results likely to steer markets.
queue.summary:
Recent headlines point to the Nasdaq and S&P 500 pressing fresh highs as AI-driven momentum and easing inflation shape expectations for rate cuts. Investors are positioning for further policy support while watching earnings trends. 

In the week ahead, traders will focus on the Fed policy decision on September 17, key inflation readings (CPI/PPI), and mega-cap reports that could sustain or recalibrate the rally.

queue.tweet: SPY option idea (hypothetical): buy Oct 17, 2025 655 call and sell Oct 17, 2025 675 call. Bullish debit spread with limited risk; max gain above 675 at expiry. Setup hinges on continued upside and rate-cut expectations.
queue.summary:
Option activity on SPY has shown a bullish tilt as rate-cut expectations persist and equities hold near record levels. Traders expect the upcoming data and Fed decision to drive further moves in SPY options. 

The suggested approach is a bullish debit call spread: long the Oct 17, 2025 655 call and short the Oct 17, 2025 675 call. This caps risk to the net premium while offering upside if SPY advances past the higher strike by expiry.
